org.ambraproject.wombat.freemarker

Class VariableLookupDirective<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ambraproject.wombat.freemarker.VariableLookupDirective<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of value looked up from the Java tier
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveModel, freemarker.template.TemplateModel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppLinkDirective, SiteLinkDirective, ThemeConfigDirective

    public abstract class VariableLookupDirective<T>
extends Object
implements freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveModel
    A directive that retrieves a value from the Java tier and provides it to the FreeMarker templating engine, either as raw text or as a FreeMarker variable.

    In the first mode, the directive invocation does not define any loop vars and does not have a body (i.e., it is a self-closing tag). Then, the result is written into the page body as the output of the invocation. For example: 

       <span>The value is <@myDirective foo="bar" /></span>
    resolves to 
       <span>The value is qux</span>

    In the second mode, the directive defines a loop var and has a body that refers to the loop var. Then the result will be bound to that loop var and the element body will be rendered with that variable, allowing arbitrary FreeMarker logic to be applied to it. For example: 

       <@myDirective foo="bar" ; x>
     <span>The value is ${x} and its length is ${x?length}</span>
   </@myDirective>
    resolves to 
       <span>The value is qux and its length is 3</span>

    The following are all errors:

    • <@myDirective foo="bar">Hello!</@myDirective> (has body but no loop var)
    • <@myDirective foo="bar" ; x /> (has loop var but no body)
    • <@myDirective foo="bar" ; x y>${x + y}</@myDirective> (has more than one loop var)

    The value may be of any type that the FreeMarker environment's ObjectWrapper can consume. The first mode prints the result of the value's Java Object.toString() method. The second mode uses the FreeMarker variable from ObjectWrapper. Null values are allowed only in the second mode.

      • getValue

        protected abstract T getValue(freemarker.core.Environment env,
         Map params)
                       throws freemarker.template.TemplateException,
                              IOException
        Return the value to provide as the body or loopvar.

        The env and params arguments are the same as those specified for TemplateDirectiveModel.execute(freemarker.core.Environment, java.util.Map, freemarker.template.TemplateModel[], freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveBody). Implementing classes may define their own contracts for the content of params.

        Parameters:
        env - the FreeMarker processing environment
        params - the parameters (if any) passed to the directive
        Returns:
        the result
        Throws:
        freemarker.template.TemplateException
        IOException
